medical_history.chief_complaint: Thiocyanate toxicity following ingestion of a drug with suicidal intent.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient ingested the drug one hour before presentation. Initially asymptomatic with normal mental status, she later developed dizziness and blurry vision after transfer to the tertiary pediatric center. Eleven hours post-ingestion, she became agitated and developed 20 minutes of sustained wide complex tachycardia, followed by 30 seconds of rigidity in bilateral upper extremities and leftward gaze preference that resolved spontaneously.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of depression.
